contentrichtext.text: {{Taxobox | name = Zebra moray | image = Gymnomuraena zebra by NPS.jpg | regnum = [[Animal]]ia | phylum = [[Chordate|Chordata]] | classis = [[Actinopterygii]] | ordo = [[Anguilliformes]] | familia = [[Muraenidae]] | genus = '''''Gymnomuraena''''' | genus_authority = [[Bernard Germain de Lacépède|Lacépède]], 1803 | species = '''''G. zebra''''' | binomial = ''Gymnomuraena zebra'' | binomial_authority = ([[George Shaw|G. Shaw]], 1797) | synonyms = ''Echidna zebra'' | range_map= | range_map_caption= }} The '''zebra moray''', ''Gymnomuraena zebra'', is a species of [[moray eel]]. It is the only member of the genus '''''Gymnomuraena''''', though it sometimes has been included in ''[[Echidna]]'' instead. It is found at reefs in the [[Indo-Pacific]], and in the east [[Pacific]] from southern [[Baja California]], [[Mexico]] to northern [[Colombia]], including the [[Galapagos Islands]]. Its length is up to {{convert|1.5|m|ft}}, though most individuals are far smaller. It is densely banded dark and whitish, giving rise to its common name. Unlike most other moray eels, it feeds almost exclusively on [[crustacean]]s, [[sea urchins]] and [[mollusk]]s. ==References== * {{FishBase_species| genus = Gymnomuraena | species = zebra | month = June | year = 2006}} * {{ITIS |id=635323 |taxon=''Gymnomuraena''}} [[Category:Muraenidae]] [[Category:Marine fauna of the Gulf of California]] [[Category:Western Central American coastal fauna]] [[Category:Galápagos Islands coastal fauna]] [[Category:Fish of Hawaii]]
